Verified Resident
2013 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/05/2016
This is a well kept community, pretty safe and quiet, in a great location. The condition of my apartment is very good and the buildings are only 10 years old. The cons depend on the current management, but I see as: 1) mostly transient residents so hard to build a community or know your neighbors well. 2) rent increases at least 5% every year 3) They don't adequately monitor restricted breeds of dogs (my dog was attacked by a pitbull last year) 4) lots of turnover in staff and maintenance, which is a big deal when it's your home. 5) lots of pesticide use and Round Up

Report
Resident
2013 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/25/2016
Overall I really enjoyed my time at century trinity estates. My roommate and I rented a two bedroom townhouse, which had not been renovated, so I can't speak to the quality of new renovations. Pros: great location, safe community, noise issues were minimal *IF* you had good neighbors, the amount of space we got for the money was fabulous - 2 bedroom, 2.5 bath townhouse with an attached garage for $1240. I'm assuming the price has changed but comparable sized places elsewhere are above $1400. Maintenance improved significantly in the three years we were there (it was really bad at first) and by the end they were very prompt and responsive. The pool is enormous for an apartment complex, and even though the kids were a little rowdy at times, that's what happens when you live in a family friendly community. No complaints there! I also really loved valet trash, even if it did cost $28.50. Management I feel really tries to keep residents updated on issues, both within the community (trash issues, etc.) and within the local area (power outages, etc.). Cons: The cost of this place was reflected in the construction, which really was not great. The carpet had zero padding under it, which was a problem because there were nails underneath that were not hammered in properly that we would step on. Frequently. Walls were thin, so the few times that our neighbors were noisy, you could hear everything. I once had a painting fall off of my bedroom wall because of banging around next door. Out ceilings were uneven, and our kitchen equipment while functional was shoddy and cheap. The electricity was weird too...we lost two coffee makers and a microwave out of the blue. Lights and outlets would be out for days and then would spontaneously work again...Our downstairs was incredibly drafty. You could actually see the sunlight coming in through the improperly sealed front door. Upstairs we would set the thermostat to 68, and it would be cozy, but downstairs would be at least 10 degrees colder in the winter. The gym had a few pieces of cardio equipment, but at least two were not working regardless of when you went. Overall, you get what you pay for, and the space, amenities, and cost really outweighed the negatives.

Report
Resident
2015 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/31/2016
I found Century Trinity online for my daughter who goes to Duke Law school. Being from California it was difficult to make a decision. We called and spoke to Tangela in the office to get a lot of questions answered which was awesome. She was very informative. We were concerned with safety as we knew there were other apartment complexes in Durham that have had break in issues. Century Trinity Estates hasn't had any break ins which was a huge plus. You can call the police department for break in information which I did as well. After visiting Durham now a few times and seeing the accommodations all over I can say this is one of the best. The place is clean, safe, free parking, super quiet and is in a great location to get to everything. Target, Trader Joe's, Kroger, Bed Bath and Beyond, Home Depot, whatever it's all super close by. UNC and Duke are about 5-15 minutes away. The office staff are super friendly, kind and attentive. We have no issues with the apartment at all. It was very clean and well maintained before occupancy. I would recommend CTE to someone looking to move to the area.

I am 68 years old, a college graduate and a veteran of the US Army. I am in my 3rd year here at Century Trinity Estates and I give it my highest rating. The location is convenient for shopping, and many restaurants and medical facilities are close by. The place has a pool which is well-kept and the management holds parties for events like the 4th of July or Labor Day, usually at poolside, for the residents and often include food, beverages and entertainment for the kiddies. Report
Resident
2013 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/22/2015
My husband and I moved here with our two daughters (ages 3 and 5) to attend grad school at Duke. We've been here for two years now in two different apartments and continue to be very happy. This is not the typical undergrad apt complex and that's one of the reasons we've stayed. Many of the residents are post-doc, business or law students at Duke or UNC and young professionals with families. The complex is right between great shopping and a very nice residential area. My husband bikes to Duke hospital and we are a ten-minute drive from UNC. Also, Forest View Elementary school is one of the best in Durham! Felicia, the office staff and many of the maintenance staff know us by name, are wonderful with our children, and when we had family in town they bent over backwards to accommodate them in the community areas. We lost our cat shortly after moving here and Felicia emailed, texted, and even tried to catch him with food. They work hard to make the complex feel like a community with ice cream socials, pool parties, and trick-or-treat. As far as the complaints are concerned, I would point to the lease. You have to actually read it! There are no surprise expenses and I've never felt like management tried to trick, delay repairs, or provide less than great service. Our apartment is very quiet. I occasionally hear the baby next door but only because our families have the same bathtime before bed and only if he's crying. I once had a maintenance issue that wasn't an emergency, but needed to be fixed before wintertime, so I walked into the leasing office, asked if they had time to fix it, and it was fixed the same day. This is a great place to live!!

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/01/2015
The availability of the single-story cottages is a major plus and the reason we picked this complex. The grounds are nice, and noise is not a problem in the quieter outlying cottages (can't speak to the apartment complexes in the center). The management staff are friendly and courteous, though they seem stretched a little thin. Our biggest complaint with them is that emails, voicemails, and questions submitted via the online web portal are rarely answered. The maintenance staff are similarly professional and competent, though clearly stretched a little too thin, which has resulted in waits of several days at times for basic and essential repairs (e.g. basic plumbing). The complex is in the process of renovating several units, which is nice (we're in one of the units that is already renovated - nothing spectacular but definitely consistent with industry standard) but I've seen the maintenance staff working on those renovations, which I guess explains why critical maintenance requests at my unit go unanswered for days at a time. Nothing personal against the staff, but I guess they must not be supported very well by their corporate overlords. The resulting hassle and overall lack of support unfortunately leads me to recommend against living here.

2012 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/22/2015
I am a single women living in a one-bedroom apartment and I love it. The apartment layout is convenient, it's clean and most importantly I feel safe. I utilize the onsite laundry facility, fitness center, pool (seasonally) and car wash station regularly. The valet trash service has me spoiled! I occasionally hear my neighbors shower, but never anything else. The noise doesn't bother me, it's an apartment and to be expected. I often run/walk in the community and surrounding neighborhoods and have never had any issues. Additionally, the utilities are very inexpensive. With the exception of the extreme heat in summer or occasional snow in the winter, I am able to be very liberal with my thermostat and most days only turn it on at night. The large windows also create a great fresh air atmosphere, which I really enjoy. I have never had a problem with the management staff. In fact, they are always pleasant and very courteous, often calling me by my name. The office hours are reasonable and they are great about communicating repairs/updates/events as needed. I have lived here for 3 years and am very pleased. I highly recommend this community to other individuals/families looking for a casual place to call home. Only friendly, respectable, responsible adults please!

Verified Resident
2013 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/20/2015
Overall, I have enjoyed my time here at Century Trinity Estates. My biggest issue has been noise from neighboring apartments. It seems that the walls are very thin and almost any moderate amount of noise (conversations, TV, music, and walking from above) is easily transmitted. Aside from this, I have had good experience with the functioning of my apartment (appliances, washer/dryer, heat/AC) with one exception - low water pressure from the shower head. The maintenance department has always responded promptly and adequately to my service requests. The ability to place service requests online and to pay rent online has been very convenient. The appearance and upkeep of the property is generally very good. The gym is a bit outdated and could use some newer machines, but I realize this is probably an expensive change to make. For what it is, the gym does function. The leasing staff have been pretty good, although sometimes emails I send are never answered. Sometimes it seems that it's necessary to speak with someone in person to get important things sorted out. All in all, I have been satisfied for the price I have paid.

They never ask you how your day's been or make any sort of small talk to make it seem like they care about you as a person, and you always get the feeling that they can't wait for you to leave. I ordered a lot of stuff online, so I was always in & out picking up packages. You'd think they would make an effort to get to know me a little bit, but they always seemed annoyed and curt. ----, the property manager, is kind of a ------ and needs to learn some social skills--he does this weird thing where he just stares you down, unsmiling, and never breaks eye contact. As a biology major, I learned that animals do this under two circumstances: confrontation and mating. Pretty uncomfortable. Sometime during my lease, they decided they wanted to implement valet waste and charge us an additional $30/month for it even though we never signed on for it, pulling the "too bad, there's language in your lease that says we can do this" card. They eventually relented after enough people pushed back, but I think this says something about their priorities. Basically, this company feels VERY corporate. The units themselves are fine. If you take a tour, what you see is what you get. For the most part, they are clean and in good condition. No major complaints. However, their pricing has gotten a bit out of hand. I paid $730/month for my 1 bedroom apartment, which I thought was a good deal at the time. When my lease was ending, they offered me a renewal rate of $780/month, which is a pretty big increase (plus an additional $30 for the valet waste I'd have to begin paying). If you're a new renter, their website says prices now start at $850/month, which I assume does not include the valet waste charge. I would not pay $880/month to deal with the crappy management, and I would be wary of future price increases. Parking is terrible if you live in one of the units in the back. If you get home after 9, be prepared to park at least 2 buildings away. I wouldn't complain if this was a rare occurrence, but it was literally every night. Very annoying after a trip to the supermarket or during bad weather. Finally, I have to remark on how ridiculous it is that they have resorted to posting positive reviews for themselves. Glowing, non-specific, 3 sentence paragraphs that suddenly begin appearing after months of bad reviews? Sure. At least have the guts to respond to the bad reviews and offer to talk, like other managers do.

If you take a tour, what you see is what you get. For the most part, they are clean and in good condition. No major complaints. However, their pricing has gotten a bit out of hand. I paid $730/month for my 1 bedroom apartment, which I thought was a good deal at the time. When my lease was ending, they offered me a renewal rate of $780/month, which is a pretty big increase (plus an additional $30 for the valet waste I'd have to begin paying). If you're a new renter, their website says prices now start at $850/month, which I assume does not include the valet waste charge. I would not pay $880/month to deal with the crappy management, and I would be wary of future price increases. Parking is terrible if you live in one of the units in the back. If you get home after 9, be prepared to park at least 2 buildings away. I wouldn't complain if this was a rare occurrence, but it was literally every night. Very annoying after a trip to the supermarket or during bad weather. Finally, I have to remark on how ridiculous it is that they have resorted to posting positive reviews for themselves. Glowing, non-specific, 3 sentence paragraphs that suddenly begin appearing after months of bad reviews? Sure. At least have the guts to respond to the bad reviews and offer to talk, like other managers do. Read less

Report
Resident
2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/20/2013
I will let you know honestly, there has not been one resident that I have met that has been content with the services provided (or rather lack there of), at Century Trinity Estates in Durham. Looking back at my apartment search, I really wish I had taken these reviews more seriously. There are so many maintenance issues not to mention 90% of the staff have no customer service experience at all. The priority of any apartment complex should be customer service and it is not. I have not had any interaction with the manager here who seems to be absent when anything bad is going on. He/she could at least check on apartments every once in a while to make sure all problems are fixed. Staff members here are 100% condescending (which has already been mentioned, but I wanted to really re-emphasize this). Staff members do not listen to your issues, they just talk over you and dodge questions about sketchy fees. I feel like none of maintenance requests have ever been fixed thoroughly in one sitting. I have lived in some crappy apartments in College and this complex is the shadiest one ever due to their lack in customer service and ability to provide a decent apartment to live in (have even found what looks like black mold in a lot of areas). I am never heard when I have reported different work orders that need to be fulfilled, but the problems we have encountered at this apartment are just so beyond the help we could receive at this point. Just a few of the dozens of problems we have had here: When we first moved in the door knob wasn t secured onto the door? The cheap screen windows and doors always fall off which I have seen in several other neighbors homes as well. There is mold all over the windows and bathrooms from poor draining of water, the smoke alarms are hyper sensitive and basically go off when you just light a candle, we have had wasp nests outside of our balcony (which considering we are paying a pest-fee each month, has never fully been exterminated). When my room mates toilet broke, we had to share a bathroom for a week because maintenance was so busy fulfilling other jobs (which should have been a huge red flag), they are clearly under staffed and the fact that there are that many issues is scary. There is no parking, which was mentioned when we signed our lease but now I know why this was emphasized: because sometimes you have to park several buildings away which sucks when you have groceries! There is dog poop everywhere because no one cleans up after their dogs, I have to wear rain boots everywhere just to make sure I don't step in it every time I walk outside, and I am really not a clean freak person at all! The breezeways are just disgusting, I think they have been cleaned once this year, and my boyfriend had to kill a copper head that was in front of a woman s apartment that had small children! But no one would notice that here because no one manages the property properly. There was rubbish including parts of broken glass and sharp metals taking up about 2 parking spaces outside of our garage that were just in bags (not even boxes, just spilling everywhere), when there was construction happening, just left out for a child or dog to run into by mistake. This was a HUGE SAFETY HAZARD! Every time that I try to use the grill the propane has been empty. When plumbers have come in to fix our bathtubs from leaking they told us this was due to the cheap plumbing that has been in this complex before we moved in, and wouldn t be fixed because it would take thousands of dollars to re-do. Meanwhile I go through about a half foot of dripping water a day in my tub that probably makes a significant dent in my water bill which I cannot control because no one is going to fix the plumbing. There is black colored mold everywhere?! My Mom came to visit, who is highly allergic and was having asthma attacks because it s so bad here. I wake up with a sore throat often because my asthma is triggered by mold which has clearly never been cleaned out because its all over the bathroom tiles no matter how much I clean it off ( I know it is not soap scum I know the difference!) and all encrusted in the window panes. There is yellow run-off water that streams in through the windows somehow when it s a damp day and we find puddles everywhere on the carpet and it s also causing the wood on the windows to expand and crack etc... This place smells like garbage because the bin is always overflowing even with the new trash clean up services (which no one ever seemed to want to begin with). I will make sure to tell everyone I know that the customer service at this complex is absolutely outrageous. One anonymous writer puts it very clearly that the staff members here are condescending, and I think belittling, and treat the residents here like garbage. The fees here are incredible! And I was shocked to hear about the trash deal because I had complained about not wanting to add $28 a month to my bill and no one here did anything about it, so now I know why someone finally did ... because of a lawsuit. It's sad that no voices are heard here unless it's in the form of a threat to the complex.

I also live at Century Trinity Estates and I can honestly say that I have not experienced ANY of the issues you're having. In fact, I have basically the opposite feelings in almost every way. My apartment is great. It's spacious, has a great layout, a nice pantry and we rarely hear our neighbors. Whenever I submit a maintenance request, it is addressed within 24 hours. Additionally, our maintenance is usually light bulbs, and the occasional shower drain. I have NEVER had an issue with mold, and attribute that to the fact that we keep a clean home. Even the fanciest of houses have dirt when not tended to... As for parking, again, not an issue. At all. And I see my neighbors cleaning up after their pets on a daily basis. I am on a first name basis with the management team, and find every single one of them to be courteous and helpful. But again, it's a two way street. I have polite manners and treat them with respect, so that's what I get in return. I often have dinner parties, friends or out of town guests visit. I have only ever received compliments on my home. It is safe, clean and meets every one of my needs. I do recommend Century Trinity Estates and I do enjoy living there.

2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/15/2013
AVOID. If you would like your monthly payments to your landlord to be predictable, I highly recommend you AVOID this property. This means that the management company at this property has attempted to add $42.12 per month to the monthly lease rate, which equals $505.44 over the course of a 12 month lease. They've done this three times now in 5 months, and there is absolutely no reason to think that they will stop. The fees at this apartment have been raised three times since I moved here, and they do no respect the written lease. First, on 05/08/13, a "Trash Disposal Fee" of $8.50 appeared on the utilities bill. But this amount had already included in the lease. No memo or notification was ever circulated explaining this or that any change in billing had taken place. Secondly, on 08/05/13, the property management announced another increase in trash fees. This time, they announced they were tacking an additional $28.50 onto the original trash rate. They only backed off when one of my neighbors threatened legal action. Thirdly, on 10/08/13, they announced that they would begin charging a "Storm Water" fee of $5.12.

Resident
2012 - 2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/29/2013
I moved to Century Trinity Estates last summer. Compared to my previous apartment, I am much happier now. Our apartment has a fireplace, open arrangement, large kitchen and cupboards and a great balcony. I love gardening and was able to grow beautiful flowers, a variety of peppers and lemons which makes our balcony a wonderful place to relax. The pool and fitness center are always clean and uncrowded and I appreciate the valet trash pick up. If I had anything I would change, I would have a larger storage unit on the balcony, a detachable hose on the kitchen sink and overhead lighting in the bedrooms. But that's just apartment living. The transition to Century Trinity Estates was a little rocky at first, but I have never had an issue when maintenance, attitude or safety. They respond quickly and politely and offer a lot in regards to hosting community events.

Report
Resident
2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/11/2013
Century Trinity took a perfectly fine property and they destroyed it. Don't be fooled by their cute, professionally-designed website. In late February, 2013 (02/22/13), a half-way decent property ("Addington Farms") was sold off, and it was renamed to "Century Trinity Estates." Since then, the quality and my husband and my experience has really suffered in so many ways; some of which I will list. The very worst part of living at Century Trinity is the management staff. Management staff at Century Trinity is rude, uncaring, and condescending. They treat residents like garbage. Complete garbage.Even when they are in the office, the management staff do not pick up the phone. They have an email address, but it doesn't seem like anyone is on the other side. How is one to file maintenance requests if they work during business hours? Well, I haven't figured that one out yet. The approach of the management staff is extremely heavy-handed in every way. Let me give some examples. The management staff posts signs on the property threatening prosecution for anyone who dares to walk past the pool after 9pm, even if they are taking a short cut to their apartment. I can't quite understand why it would be a problem to walk the shortest distance to my apartment from the gym, when I visit the gym at night. Second example: When the management has to block off large parts of the parking lot to do work on a property or to repave the parking lot, they leave signs out indicating that they will tow cars "at the owner's expense," if you left your car there before they put up the signs. So, if you parked there, went out of town, and then came back, you would not only find that your car had been towed, but you would also be presented with a bill. Never before did the previous management leave such heavy-handed, threatening emails around the property. Never. The management at this location is fundamentally dishonest. Several friends of mine who moved out have indicated to me that their security deposit was not returned to them, despite the fact that they had not caused any damage to the property. Management at Century Trinity recently raised trash collection fees from $8.50 to $28.50. There was no change in the lease, they just want to collect more fees from residents, while offering additional services that no one asked for or wants. I haven't spoken with them about this yet, but a friend of mine did, and they essentially laughed at him, and essentially they said something like: "We have a right to change any fees we want. Read your lease." Apparently, soon after the change from Addington Farms to Century Trinity, someone in the management office wrote a fake, positive review of this property, on 5/14/2013. See http://www.apartmentratings.com/rate/NC-Durham-Century-Trin . The only positive reviews on this site for this property after it became Century Trinity were written by management staff. Apparently, according to some reviwers on this site, they offer gift cards to residents to bribe them to write reviews on this website. Quality of service has declined at this property since Century Trinity took over, and sometimes, as a result, they fail even to meet industry standards for "luxury" class apartments (which is the term they use on their website to advertise themselves). A couple of months ago, I discovered that they no longer changed air filters, whereas the former owners did just that. Not only that, but they haven't notified anyone about the change. It seems as though management is currently struggling to find tenants for this property. They routinely hire poorly dressed men, who appear possibly to be homeless, to stand at the the 15-501 and Garrett Rd. intersection, advertising the property with a big sign, which reads "free rent." This is embarrassing and a poor reflection on a property, which pretends to be a "luxury" accomodation (see their website). When Addington Farms managed the property, they responded to service requests in under 24 hours. Century Trinity's record is quite poor. It usually takes them several days. Century Trinity must have fired most of the staff and continued charging the same rates, because they take 3 days to respond to service requests. My friends confirm that this has been their experience too. Air conditioners at this property are really old. They break easily and often. In the summer, in North Carolina, this creates a terrible living environment. The previous owner replaced filters on a quarterly basis. They did not announce the change in policy, but simply stopped replacing filters. The landscaping at Century Trinity is not only negligent, but it is also dangerous. There is a bush that blocks on-coming traffic from view. Although I've asked them to trim the bush several times, the response is always the same: "No." The trash disposal system outside was broken a couple months ago, and it took them several months to fix it. In the interim, trash piled up everywhere flowing into the street. At some points while I have lived here, the management company for unknown reasons has brought at least three enormous, overflowing, and unseemly garbage dumpsters to the property, distributing them all across the property. One of them was even sitting in the middle of the parking lot, taking up valuable parking space. Parking is a nightmare here. If you return home after 6-7pm, simply don't expect to find parking here. Management seems to do everything they can to block what little parking they do have. I've already mentioned above the garbage dumpster sitting in the parking lot for weeks on end. Also, at one point, while I lived here, management was having repairs done on a damaged building (I think). They had to bring a crane in. So they roped off a large park of the parking lot. For some reason, however, they roped it off 1 weeks before any repair equiptment even arrived. Why? It makes no sense. 25 parking spaces were gone. Just completely gone. My friends who lived in that section of the property were super pissed off. Although the business center is locked after hours, you cannot use computers in their business center without a password, but it's next to impossible to get a password from the management staff. The gym equipment is garbage. Bar bells are missing, the paper towels for removing sweat from the machines are either missing or completely dried out, the treadmills are 7-15 years old, falling apart and wires are exposed on both of them, near the front panels. Remote controls for the TVs used to be there, but now they are missing, and when they went missing, management posted signs alerting residents that they had no intention of replacing them. Why? The appliances in the apartments are old and disgusting. The sink is bad, but the ovens are even worse. When I moved in, the refrigerator had a big crack in it that had been painted over. The walls here are paper thin. To the right, I can hear my neighbors making love every other day at all sorts of weird hours, and right in front of me, I have the pleasure to listen to techno-dance music from 11pm-1am almost every night, and on the weekends, it goes even later. This apartmentratings.com website is really strange. Most of the reviews on this site do not apply to the current management, but only to previous managemnet/owners (e.g., "Addington Farms," "Alexan Farms"). Only the reviews after 03/09/2013 refer to Century Trinity Estates. My husband and I'll be leaving when our lease expires in two months, and I'll be informing *all* professional schools at UNC-Chapel Hill not to recommend this property to incoming students next year.

Resident
2012 - 2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/27/2013
Ever since the management change, this place has become very inhospitable. The service is intolerable and simply unacceptable. Everyone at the office is rude and condescending. They make several residents wait in the lobby for over 10 minutes so that they can talk to prospective residents. Their priorities clear. They'll be nice until you sign that lease. After that, they treat you like ----. They have made the ambiance really hostile by posting warning posters about entering the pool at night times (which is impossible since they lock it), not replacing the missing remote controls at the tiny, crappy gym, and fining people for leaving out the trash can outside the door past 9am. Am I living in an apartment or in a prison? ...Which brings me to the subject of trash. I used to pay ~$20 per month for trash, water, and sewer. Now I will be paying over $50, thanks to the additional pest control fee (which I had assumed would be covered by the rent, but I guess not), service fee, and the new trash service. After the trash compactor was broken and the temporary trash container was making all kinds of mess all over the place with trash spilling over for over a month (one of the trash containers is still sitting in a parking lot in the back of the complex), they started a mandatory door-to-door trash pick-up service. A few weeks ago, they distributed trash cans to each apartment and announced that a new pick-up service will begin. They did not notify the residents on any of the changes to the trash fee before the service started. Now, we ALL have to pay extra $20 each month for a service we can't opt out. It is so ridiculous to watch these people try to take as much money from the residents as they possibly can. All of that while they treat people so horribly. I guess the office is aware of how disgruntled the residents are about the service and ridiculous fee increases. They try to make up for the -------- service by hosting all of these "events" and "socials." But they aren't smart enough to realize that people won't stay here to continue to be treated this way. They aren't smart enough to realize that the kind of people they want to attract to this place who can afford these crazy fees and high rent are not going to tolerate such horrible service and ridiculous business practices. I do not recommend this place to anyone. I will be moving out as soon as my lease runs up. And I expect they'll come up with very creative ways to rip me off as I try to do so.

Resident
2010 - 2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/22/2013
I would strongly discourage anyone from renting at Century Trinity Estates as long as the current management company is in place. Since the new management company assumed control, the previously friendly vibe in the community has largely evaporated. Several restrictive pool policies have been instituted, with the added threat (posted on a flyer at the pool) that police will be called for people who are in the pool after closing. This sort of unnecessary saber-rattling does little to foster goodwill with the community. In my experience, maintenance requests go largely ignored or forgotten until they are repeated approximately three times. Most recently the trash fee has increased greater than three fold, with no possibility to opt out. Furthermore, if you do not have your garbage can in by 9 am, you will be fined $50. With most staff living on site, and the management's fondness for levying fines, I expect this rule to be closely policed. The exit onto Garrett Road is dangerous, as traffic coming from the left is obscured by the landscaping. I once came within a hairsbreadth of hitting a motorcyclist who was not visible behind the plants. I do not intend to renew my lease, and fully expect to lose my entire security deposit and likely also be charged additional amounts at move out (as has happened to several friends of mine).

Resident
2011 - 2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/16/2013
Ever since Century Trinity Estates took over, the fee has been increasing and the service has been declining. When it was Addington Farms, the monthly service fee trash fee add up to $8.5. When it became Century Trinity Estates, they charge $4.95 service fee, in addition to the $8.5 trash fee. Now there is an additional $20 for the absurd trash service! They collect trash between 6-8 pm on weekdays, and the trash can is not allowed to be outside of the apartment during the day (otherwise there is a fine!). I am never home before 8pm, so I will never be able to use the "service", but I still need to pay for the additional $20! And they say it is to improve the service quality? How absurd and ironic is that. So they collect trash 20 days a month, 2 hours each day. That's 40 hours of labor. There are about 250 residents, so they would be able to collect about $5,000 per month for the service. The hourly salary is over $100 for trash collection! I would be happy to have a job that pays this well! Moreover, since they took over, my water bill has almost doubled. They also started charging about $5 for "pest control" (shouldn't this be included in the service fee they charge?). Let's do the calculation, they charge about $10 more for service, $20 more for trash, and about $20 for water. Now I pay at least $50 more than before, but receive service that is far worse. Addington Farms used to get work orders done within one single day (even on weekends). Now it might take more than a week. They do not change the A-C filter unless you tell them to (Addington Farms used to change the filter every quarter). They charge for pest control, yet there are more pests in the building than ever! The stairs are so dirty, with worms and cobwebs everywhere. Where did they spend the pest control fee on? In retrospect, it used to be so clean when it was Addington Farms. The service level has sunk so low in just a few months, and god knows what new charges would they come up with in the near future! They spend all their time thinking about how to charge residents without improving their service. Stay away if you can.

Resident
2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/12/2013
One of the nice things about living at Addington Farms was that it was located on the Chapel Hill line, and thus far from the Chapel Hill ghetto. All this changed when Addington Farms was sold, and it was renamed to Century Trinity. They have allowed Food Trucks to park in the parking lot. I repeat: Food trucks! How ghetto does it get? I had some classmates from the law school over for dinner, and I was embarrassed when they laughed at me for having a food truck parked behind my apartment. How ghetto does it get? I'm currently trying to get out of my lease a couple months early, but I don't think it will happen. These people are not flexible. I've lived in 2 other places in Durham, and never have I come across people who were so inflexible. This apartment complex has tried to BUY our love and affection. They offer freebies to leave "positive" feedback on this website, they hold silly little events around the pool, but they quickly run out of food and drinks, and what's the most ridiculous, they've offered some stupid trash service. Why is it stupid? Because they promise you a $50 fine if you forget to take the trash can in at 9am. Have to rush out the door and you somehow forget. Oops. $50 fine. Rather than try to BUY our love and affection, why don't you start managing this property correctly? Here are some suggestions: pick up the phone when someone calls, don't lose packages that are delivered, treat us with respect and kindness (and not just when we're signing the lease), return emails, and get repairs done in under 3 days. Is that really so much to ask for? Stop trying to BUY our love and affection! A real problem at this property. The plants completely obstruct the view when you're trying to pull out. My friends have complained about this to management, and management laughs at them. It makes me sick. Why won't they just trim the flower bed or move it somewhere else? I simply don't understand it. So frustrated. Can't wait to move.

Resident
2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/30/2013
I lived here when it was owned by Riverstone Residential and called Addington Farms. Overall, the staff was really helpful and nice. But when the new Century management came in and renamed the place "Trinity Estates" the tenor of the community changed. The Good: * The service staff is awesome. All of the service and maintenance staff has been incredibly nice and helpful, going above and beyond. * The facilities are good. * The location is really convenient--near a Target, Kroger, and Harris Teeter. And only about 10 minutes away from a Whole Foods and a Trader Joe's. It's about 15 minutes from both downtown Durham and Downtown Chapel Hill, and about 8 minutes from Duke's Campus. * A very family-oriented community. There are a lot of kids and it seems like families have formed a community and do things together, which is nice to have a neighborhood feel in an apartment complex. This is different from any other complex I've lived in. * There are some really unique floor plans! There are two- and three-bedroom units that are three story townhomes with garages on the bottom. There are also really nice cottages with wrap around porches and a one-car garage. The Bad: * The management has been markedly not friendly. They've made no effort to get to know residents. The internet password didn't work for several weeks, and I asked repeatedly. I was told the same password that was written on a poster in the business center--which didn't work. No one believed me when I said it didn't work...but then several weeks later it was changed to a similar password that did work on the signs. * We were also charged for some patchwork to the townhome that was there when we moved in--painted in the exact same color as the wall. It didn't seem like a problem and no one tought to mention it when we moved in (just skipped over it on the form because it was painted in the perfect same color from previous damage). Yet the management repeatedly said that they thought we did a 2 foot by 2 foot patch for a hole in the wall and painted it the same color beige as the rest of the walls. Overall, the move-out was a nightmare. * The new management restricted the access to the pool during certain hours. I find it really sad to not be able to grill out by the pool any more because the gates seem to lock at 6pm. * It is really family oriented. This is good, but if you don't have a family, it may be inconvenient to have 12 kids at the pool every day. http://www.yelp.com/biz/century-trinity-estates-apartments-durham

Resident
2010 - 2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/03/2013
UPDATE POSTED AT THE END! Still Overall positive review but with glaring concerns given the new fees. ORIGINAL POST: I had a mixed experience with the prior management and I am a young professional with several prior moves related to education/jobs so the change in the management was not as jarring to me as it may have been to others. I recall a no-so-favorable first interaction with the Century Trinity staff but since that time things have gone pretty well. The first interaction made me feel like an attempt to add an additional fee without listening to my issue. I received a lovely retraction of that fee after I voiced my concern and its been fine ever since. They are responsive to emails and concerns! I have an inbox full of messages. There are some novices on the staff but that seems to be expected. The issue with the trash mentioned in a prior post is a sore sight but its temporary! They've informed us that a new trash compactor is on its way. Its only been 2 weeks, so relax. I like that we get emails/calls notifying us when packages have been left for some time. That was not done under the prior management. There are probably lots of things they are trying to clean up that go unrecognized by us as tenants. I can't comment on the issue with locked codes on the computers, etc. I am sure if you ask, they will give you the codes. I also cannot comment on current rental rates since I locked in mine a couple years ago when I first moved here. I can say that I was shocked at the rate for month to month lease, seems to be abnormally high but again, I haven't been out in the rental market for sometime. The grounds are very clean. Those flowers that block the view were there LAST summer as well under prior management. I remember thinking at the time that I should say something to them, but never did. I think folks should give the new management a break. There are probably some growing pains but they are trying. My recommendation is to check out this property and others. I think you will find the young professional with and without kids mix very appealing. It is close to EVERYTHING. it takes me 8 mins to get to my garage at Duke. I feel safe here. I feel like my needs/concerns are addressed in a timely fashion. If anything changes, I'll be sure to repost but for now, I am staying put. UPDATE: I've edited this review because of the recent trash fee. I've seen the scathing reviews and many of the issues I've not encountered. Last month a "service" became available. This door to door trash collection service was a nice surprise. The problem is that we were not informed that an additional 20 bucks per month fee was attached! One week after the service was in place we received a notice telling us about the new fee. I was pissed and wrote to the management. The response was they relayed tenants concerns to the owner, but the owner of the property is staying firm on the fees. I must then adjust this review. I still recommend the place but with caution. What else in terms of fees are in the pipeline? How much is too much? Will we be informed? Who knows?

Resident
2011 - 2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/12/2013
WOW. Ever since the management changed hands and the complex's name was changed to a retirement-community-esque title, things have gone way, way downhill. I was generally pretty happy with Addington Farms and the staff (they really liked my dog and I think that affection transferred over to me, ha!), and had no real complaints. All this changed when the management did. The first thing that had me suspicious was the presence of a homeless-looking man standing outside one of the entrances holding one of those giant signs telling people to move to CTE. I am not exaggerating when I say that he literally looked HOMELESS. Thankfully, I only saw him once, but still...that's not something I generally expect from a fairly nice complex. Parking has become a disaster too. I'm not sure if more people are living in the units or what, but it's sometimes impossible to find a spot anywhere near my unit. People throw parties and either the cops show up and bust the underagers or I drive by beer cans littering the area. The lawncare people come maybe half as often, so lawns are frequently overgrown and the bushes by one of the entrances have gotten huge, making visibility hard when exiting the complex. The staff tapes passive-aggressive notes up around the pool area that threaten to call the cops on people in the pool after hours. Klassy. The staff are incredibly rude and impossible to deal with. They don't respond to emails and they act as if dealing with tenants is an inconvenience. Horrible. All this and they have the audacity to jack up rent prices. I'll be leaving when my lease is up and will not recommend this to anyone looking for housing in the area.

2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/14/2013
I moved into my apartment last month and I love it. I live in the Barcelona layout and I love how open it is. The kitchen is easily accessible and isn't closed off. My bedroom, the 2nd bedroom, is spacious and my bathroom is huge! The neighbors are friendly and the people in the office are very helpful. I put in my first work order for my garbage disposal and maintenance came very quickly. I also love the location of the complex because I can get to Franklin St in Chapel Hill or Downtown Durham or 9th/Broad Street within 10 minutes. I was not too keen on having to move to Durham because my job got relocated, but I am happy with where I live and I hope to stay here for a while!

Resident
2010 - 2012 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/13/2012
I have lived here for two years and have few complaints. I love the layout of the community: apartments, townhouses and cottages ... it feels more like a community and less like an apartment complex. The amenities include: outdoor pool, business center, fitness room, tennis court, playground, lake and laundry facility. The office staff is nice and helpful. When I moved in, maintenance was guaranteed in 24 hours ... I think the policy is still the same. Every time I have put in a request it is addressed quickly. They also host BBQs, free breakfast and games/prizes for the residents. My only complaint is that depending on where you live in the community sometimes it is hard to find a parking spot in front of your unit if you come home late, sometimes I have to park 2-3 units away, but not a problem if you get home at a decent hour. Great location if you work at Duke ... nice community. Have recommended this place to many former residents and will continue to recommend to others. Thanks :)

Resident
2011 - 2012 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/03/2012
I've lived at Addington Farms twice now, with two totally different experiences. The first time around (2008-2009) was great. The staff was friendly, the maintenance was timely and the grounds were well kept. I left NC for two years of grad school and returned to Addington Farms in 2011. Over the next year the front office staff all quit and the head maintenance guy left. What remains is horrible. Grounds: The dog waste bins overflow and stink up the entire property. Maintenance: Maintenance is slow and unsatisfactory at best. When the previous tenant left a washer/dryer in my apt (that was somehow overlooked while they were turning the property over) and I asked to have it removed (my movers would install my washer/dryer if they had access), the complex refused at first, then insisted I order my movers to help remove the old washer/dryer because they were "understaffed" for the day. The head of maintenance personally accosted the movers for a good half-hour before calling his on-call helper to get it moved. The entire charade added hours to my move and was horribly unprofessional of them. Staff: Friendly when you're a prospective tenant, cold once you've signed a lease. They have autonomy over most things, but blame the 'corporate headquarters' whenever they over-charge you for rent (repeatedly) or fail to fix a maintenance issue. Our AC went out every other day for most of June, apparently it was Corporate's fault they couldn't fix it. How does that make sense? Overall: A headache. No clue what happened to this place over the past year, but I'd think very carefully before signing a lease with them now.

Resident
2004 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/10/2012
I've lived here a decade, through several changes in property ownership and management. Assistant Manager Felicia Henry is a standout across the years, among all the customer-facing staff I've interacted with here. It's one thing to do your routine job very well (from my resident viewpoint, Felicia shines at this). It's another thing to rise responsively, flexibly and creatively to special challenges as they emerge and disrupt life. Felicia does this, too, and it reveals the authenticity of her customer service passion and ethic. It also showcases her operational competence, resilience and integrity. I've experienced several occasions here where Felicia helped me navigate logistical and administrative challenges around leases, repairs, upgrades and home occupancy. Each time she did it with friendly, attentive can-do reassurance which conveyed that my well being really matters to her. On top of all this, Felicia is pure sunshine! Her welcoming, warm-hearted good cheer isn't just all-natural, it's unstoppable. She has an ebullient life-affirming quality that radiates out through her customer service. I truly feel valued, cared about and cared for by her, which is definitely a factor that continues to makes this community a desirable place to live.

2010 - 2012 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/25/2012
We have loved our time in Addington Farms apartment and cottage complex. It is conveniently located between Chapel Hill and Durham, N.C., and has a real community feel, with a diversity of housing options and current residents--- young families, singles, and older people. The landscaping is well-kept, with attention to it each week, and the apartments have efficient and well thought-out layouts. Our few maintenance needs have been readily taken care of, and the staff is very friendly. In a cottage, we share no walls with anyone, and have a garage for which there is no extra charge. We are sorry to leave!

I moved to Addington Farms a couple of months ago and I wanted to let people know what a great experience I have had so far. We moved to the area due to a family members treatment at Duke and thus knew nothing about the area. The staff has been so helpful, answering any questions we have had and pointing us the right direction for everything we have needed. As with any community, things break, but maintenance is very responsive and friendly. Overall, the community is everything we could have hoped for. Thank you!

Resident
2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/08/2011
My family recently moved out of Addington Farms because my husband finished school at Duke. This apartment complex is amazing, we loved living there the last two years. It doesn't feel like an apartment complex at all, more like a nice neighborhood. The office/maintenance staff are great, prompt and treat you well. There are lots of families there and my two girls made alot of friends at the pool and playground. I took my girls outside alot and I always felt safe at Addington, I also did alot of running in the next neighborhood over and felt safe as I exercised. The location is awesome, close to everything we needed and close to Duke. We lived an end unit townhouse and really loved the big windows that let in tons of natural light. We rarely had to contact maintenance about anything and when we did, they were fast in getting things fixed. I think it is important for people to remember that you won't find a "perfect" apartment complex, but this place is definitely one of the best around, and the things we didn't like (which were very few..ie...not enough sidewalks, no speedbumps on the road going past the park) are far less than the tons of things we DID like. We had an amazing experience here, I would recommend this complex/neighborhood...to anyone, ESPECIALLY families.

Report
Resident
2008 - 2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/18/2011
Not family friendly. Inconsiderate neighbors. 1.) Addington's lax stance to community watch. Ivy Meadow Ln is a private road that is not patrolled by Durham PD. Because of this and the large population of vehicles crammed together, auto break-ins top the crime list. A few days after a crime was reported (we called 911 once, as instructed by AF, when we saw a car with a broken window outside our townhouse), a letter would be stuffed in the back door (the one next to our garage) alerting us. A white letter folded and stuffed in a white door frame...went unnoticed by several folks for days. We often didn't notice ours, but our neighbors first. Lock and alarm your cars. 2.) Lack of sidewalks. Folks drive much too fast, especially around the tennis courts and playground. Definitely did not feel safe going for walks with a child (either in the stroller or wagon, walking along side me, or riding around on his trike). We often went for walks on Landsbury Dr. instead. Much quieter traffic wise and the neighbors are very sweet. 3.) Parking is an issue throughout the entire community. Units housed more individuals than there were parking places for them. End townhouse units frequently house three tenants with three cars. Unfortunately, they only had two parking spots (garage and driveway) which meant that parking was limited for all, including their and everyone's guests. 4.) AF should have a contract like hotels do about parties. Lots of parties. Lots of noise from folks spilling out of the units and into the street. We called Durham PD several times when the hootin' and hollerin' didn't let up late into the night. Lots of "woo girls" though I was surprised how many were also woo guys. We also witnessed guests PEEING in the bushes next to folks back doors. 5.) We lived in a townhouse where my 18 month old son's bedroom window overlooked the tennis courts. Although the hours on the court ended at 9 pm, it didn't stop folks from playing until midnight or later. The lights were bright and the walls were thin, so we heard the ball, as well as the banter, going back and forth. We bought black out curtains and a white noise machine so he wouldn't wake up. Also, no trash can. All the metal tops from the tennis ball packages ended up in my son's hands. Cigarette butts were also a nuisance. Trash cans would help eliminate this. In photos promoting the community, benches and trash cans are seen on the tennis courts. These are not there. 6.) Recycling bins filled too quickly. At times we just left our paper bags of recycling next to the bins. 7.) Walls are too thin. You'll hear doors slamming three townhouse units away. It's not like they are purposely slamming them...it's just the way the doors shut if folks don't close them. Secure frames to the wall with double sided tape or you'll be constantly fixing them. We heard our neighbor thumping about for two weeks before we realized he wasn't hanging photos or building furniture. AF offered to send a letter. We insisted that they come to our unit to hear what we heard. The manager refused, further insisting that he was the only one in the office and couldn't leave (though in our three years there, we often saw the sign indicating that the office was closed and the manager would return at the a certain time). We refused to let the matter be solved by a letter. Eventually, the manager called the unit next to us. Tenant said he was exercising. 8.) DOG POOP. Tenants don't pick up after their pups. Which is REALLY gross when you have a young child. Ugh, it was horrible not letting my son run in the grass. Poop is left on the SIDEWALKS and on the grass. Dog pooping should not be allowed around the playground and tennis courts. All in all, not a fun experience raising a family here.

Resident
2009 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/10/2011
We have been here during graduate school at Duke and have had a very positive experience. When we originally moved in we became well aquainted with the maintenance staff as we had a few requests early on. They have always been very quick to respond and I am happy to say that the same team of guys are still here today, that means a lot when you get to know & trust the people who are in and out of your home from time to time. The office staff has also been very helpful over the years and we enjoy bringing our dog by the office for a treat when we have business there...it's a nice touch! Parking can be a little tight if you come home late at night in certain areas but you deal with that in most apartment complexes that we've lived at. Other than that we have really enjoyed living here and hate to leave. But after graduation our jobs will move us across country. For those of you who are looking for a quites, professional, friendly and family oriented neighborhood we highly reccomend Addington Farms. Thanks to all for a wonderful home for the past 2 and a half years!

Resident
2010 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/03/2011
We have been very happy living at Addington Farms. The residents are friendly. The office staff is pleasant and responsive. We had just a few maintenance issues after we moved in and each was handled quickly and efficiently. We have had no troubles with insects of any kind (as one previous post mentioned) and there is ample parking directly in front of our building (as another post mentioned) so maybe that varies depending on the building. We live on the top floor, so I can't speak to the noise issues that other people have mentioned. It's very quiet here. We really like the grounds. They are nicely kept, there is a little pond that has become home to some canadian geese, there's a small play area for kids and lots of little green spaces. We're surrounded by woods... one morning I walked to my car and was actually greeted by a deer standing about 10 feet away! The location is perfect - a quick drive to Duke or UNC, but also an easy drive to grocery stores and target, southpoint, libraries, etc. There's not too much that you can walk to from here though, so a car is probably a must. We thoroughly researched our options before choosing Addington Farms and felt like it was the best value - not the cheapest, but the best price for the quality, location, and amenities. After almost a year we don't have any regrets about our choice.

I don't know anyone who lives in the cottages, sorry. They are definitely cute from the outside. Have you visited in person? There are two sets of cottages - one at the front of the complex and the other at the back near the pond. That might make a difference in terms of convenience to the entrance/exit (front) or quiet/low traffic (back). I do know people who live in the town homes, and they are all having a similar, positive experience to mine. The interior of the town homes looks just like my flat - same kitchen appliances, carpet, bath and kitchen features. So, I'd assume that the cottages are the same as well. Hope that helps a little!

Resident
2008 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/03/2010
I am a graduating international MBA student at Duke. I've been living at Addington Farms for 2 years and have only minor things to complain about. Overall, it's a good place, worth the money. However, I would caution families with kids as there is not much to do with the children (unless you're moving in with other families who have kids, so that at least you're not alone in the boredom:)). The community is really boring with that respect. The playground is so-so and you need to drive somewhere else to entertain your child. It drove my wife crazy until we bought the second car so that she wasn't dependent on my tight school schedule. Another issues was the heat insulation or the lack thereof. We had to run heater all the time during the cold winter days. I guess, it's a common problem in the U.S. Noise insulation was also poor. You can hear everything your neighbor above you is doing Staff is very good and responsive to the residents' needs. We didn't have any problems with the management or maintenance personnel. Overall, I would recommend this place.

Resident
2008 - 2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2009
This is a quiet beautiful community of mostly families and graduate students. It is close to Duke and quite accessible to UNC as well. The largest units are one-story attached cottages with no walls shared with neighbors (just garage) so it's very private. They are also flat roll-ins, so they are good for wheelchairs. The floor layout and details are comfortable and attractive. The one constant irritation was the poor quality and performance of the appliances. The refrigerator made moldy-tasting ice and the dishwasher constantly left the dishes with dried-on bits of food. The maintenance crew of young men made all kinds of excuses and came back multiple times but never fixed the problems. They admitted the appliances were inferior and gave us advice for how to live with the problems. We were there for the short-term and stopped complaining after a while and just made our own ice and rewashed the dishes by hand. If the appliances worked, I could imagine living there for years, it's such a nice environment. I would recommend this community if you don't mind being very aggressive and demanding with the maintenance people. The folks in the main office are just sales and won't push the guys hard enough for customer satisfaction.

Resident
2008 - 2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/02/2009
I've been a resident at Alexan Farms for about a year now, and overall I love it! My roommates and I live in one of the 3 br/3 1/2 bath townhouses. The townhouse is very spacious and roommate friendly since we all have our own bathroom, and a half bath on the main floor for guests. The basement bedroom is significantly smaller than the two upstairs bedrooms, but still a decent size. Overall this complex is very quiet - I've never been bothered by any loud parties or anything like that. Maintenance is very nice and efficient. My one complaint (which is becoming a problem in the winter...) is that the only thermostat/temperature regulation is on the third floor so the third floor is always very HOT and the downstairs is always very COLD! Also, parking can be a little tight in certain areas of the complex which can be frustrating.

grannesmith 03/18/2011

"why not just take the other way around the complex to enter and exit." Really? That's your solution? Yes, parking is a problem in most complexes...by design. It discourages folks from having cars or having multiple cars. If it looks like a parking lot, folks will treat it like a parking lot, leaving unregistered or unused cars, RVs, trailers, etc. there for large periods of time. The best way to explain to folks the seriousness of the parking problem is to have an ambulance or firetruck cruise through Ivy Meadow Ln. Maybe a PSA video available on their website. Something that demonstrates how parking on the curb is more than just a potential accident or artificial speed bump. Perhaps only then will folks understand the enormity of parking their car next to the curb.

2005 - 2006 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/14/2008
I lived here for 6 months when I first got to grad school. I chose a 6 month lease because I was going to be buying a house and needed someplace temporarily. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous and maintenance requests made online or in person were quickly followed through on. I moved into my house with 2 weeks to go on my lease and once I notified the staff, they encouraged me to officially move out early. They were able to find a new renter for my apartment and I was refunded my rent for the last 2 weeks of the month. This is the only apartment complex that I have lived in that has provided such exceptional service and care for its renters. I had no problems with noise issues even though I lived right beside the pool. I would highly recommend this complex.

Resident
2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/30/2007
I am a third-year law student at Duke Law student and getting ready to graduate. I have nothing but praises for this place. When I was first looking for an apt, I did it online only, and was nervous that this place would look nothing like the pictures. But I was pleasantly surprised. I have had a few problems (ants when I returned after my first summer, heat went out, faucet came off), but everytime I called maintenance, they were here very quickly, and usually fixed the problem the same day if not the next. The staff is generally very nice. There was one woman who was very mean, but I think they got rid of her. I love my view of the pond and ducks, even if they do artificially try to make the water look better by dumping food coloring in the pond. At least they're trying I guess. My only qualm would be the price and parking. In the beginning of each year, parking at night is usually a problem (meaning you have to walk maybe an extra 30 yards to your apt). The price for my 2 BR/2BA is about around $1k/month. I would like it to be a bit cheaper, but I guess you get what you pay for... Overall, GREAT!

Resident
2004 - 2005 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/13/2005
I sort of hit the jackpot by living here. My friend booked this place on a bit of a whim, but I am so glad that everything worked out the way it did. I lived here for my senior year at Duke, and I could not have picked a better place. It is quiet (we are some of the only undergrads living here, so unlike the belmont people are actually repectful of one another), clean, we aren't disturbed by unruly drunken frat boys (again see Belmont for that), and there isn't any crime to speak of. In fact, we often forget to lock our apartment simply because it is a non issue here. The pool is always pristine, and the management is unbelievable. Every day they treat us with the same courteous enthusiasm as the day we first moved in. <br><br>I am only leaving because I got a job in another city, but I assure you, if you are an undergrad looking for a nice place to live and get away from the raucous of college life and still want the privacy to have a good place to hang out with your friends, looks no further than Alexan. For the older crowd, TONS of grad students live here, and about half of our neighbors are young families, so this place truly is for anyone.

2001 - 2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/30/2003
In January 2001, my wife and I were apartment hunting in the Durham area. We were praying that God would direct us to the right place where we could be happy and comfortable. Then, we saw Alexan Farms. The Staff was "GREAT" and so caring about our needs. We were given floor plans and tours of all the facilities and apartment homes. <br><br> <br><br>I have read some of the reviews and was disturbed about the issues of racism, and prejudice. I am African American and my wife is Multi-Ethnic. We never felt or was shown any kind of differences whatsoever. <br><br> <br><br>I recommend Alexan Farms to anyone. Yes, the parking is a little much, Yes, the spiders were quite numerous, but what do you expect when you live next to the woods? <br><br> <br><br>We are both professional people, my wife is studying for her doctorate and I am retired military. <br><br> <br><br>Georgia the leasing agent is great, super friendly and just a very nice person. The maintenance crew all were very nice, competent and quick to respond to the tenants needs. <br><br> <br><br>I rate Alexan Farms 8 out of 10.

Resident
2002 - 2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/25/2003
Alexan Farms is a well managed and maintained townhouse/apartment community. Our townhouse is ample in size and any concerns/problems have been seen to in a timely and professional manner. <br> <br>I was most impressed with the staff of Alexan Farms during the December ice storm. After being without power for 48 hours and with little hope for electricity anytime soon, the management offered tenants apartments in their sister operation, Alexan Place. It made a miserable situation a lot more bearable. This is what they must mean by "southern hospitality". I was impressed! <br> <br>I wouldn´t hesitate to recommend Alexan Farms to anyone!

Resident
2002 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/13/2002
I read the previous comments about a rude and prejudical staff member and wanted to voice my opinion. My wife and I (both African American) visited the mgmt office on two occasions when we were looking for a new apt. and we were both treated respectfully. <br>Eye Contact, addressed as Mr. and Mrs., given floor plans, and told that they would love to get us situated in a new apt. We were even given a listing of their special monthly prorates. I know alot of complexes avoid showing these to people they don´t want to move in and hope they´ll be discouraged by the high non-prorated rates. <br> <br>I am very sensitive to mistreatment by businesses and can pick up when I´m being treated differently because of my race (I´ve had lots of experience). But I didn´t sense this from the staff members I encountered. <br> <br>This is not to call the previous reviewer a liar I just wanted to give my fair assessment also. Maybe they finally got rid of the racist staff member that insulted the previous interviewer. <br> <br>If you want an example of racist and incompetent staff try Summit Square. Be careful they´ll be all smiles and grins until you sign the lease and then their "true colors" and opinions will hit you hard. <br> <br>Just something to think about. Read these reviews but judge things by your own experience. <br> <br>

Resident
2002 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/07/2002
My husband and I went for a visit on 9/6/02 at 1540 and pleasantly asked to see floor plans. The rental rep looked at us as if we had completely lost our minds. She was hesitant and reluctant to help us. She seemed uneasy and we did not feel welcome. When she finally left her desk to provide us with floor plans, I almost had to tear the plans away from her hands. Her entire body language and demeanor was negative. We were never asked to take a seat and she never introduced herself. <br><br><br><br><br>My husband is a professional and I am a student working on my second degree.....oh by the way we are African American. <br><br><br><br><br>In truth, there was such a profound aura of underlying prejudice that I simply looked at her...still standing of course.....and simply said "No thank you, this place is way out of our league and far from what we are looking for." Perhaps the rental rep took that comment as "they can not afford it"...on the contrary, she had already "sized" us up anyway....truth be told...who cares...No family member, co-worker, friend, or foe that we know, regardless of color...will ever consider ALEXAN FARMS. I will be vocal and truthful about our treatment!!!....I have gone so far as to alert Univeristy students! <br><br><br><br><br>Loss due to poor customer service is a tragedy....Loss due to ignorant judgemental and obviously prejudiced people is shameful. <br><br><br>

Resident
2001 - 2002 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/28/2002
Pros: Good area in terms of commute to Duke, RTP. Little to no crime. Mostly young people- grad students, parents with little kids. Good amenities- New apartments, brand new appliances, good maintenance. Weight room decent, though busy. Pool area is nice. <br> <br>Cons: A little pricey. Very little parking late at night. Spiders in the summer. Bedroom roof leaked (third floor) although I called them repeatedly. (Builder problem, not a maintenance problem.) Walls are thin. Fireplace probably not worth the extra $10 a month- tiny flue caused some smoke overflow into the room.

Report
Resident
2001 - 2002 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/24/2002
Alexan Farms on the surface looks very nice. The apartments are new and have looks of cool features. Appliances are new, so generally nothing wrong with them. Management is also very friendly, and the clubhouse is in good condition. Big problem with parking. If I come in after 9pm, I usually can´t get a parking spot anywhere near by apartment. I usually have to walk down a steep dirt hill and its pretty dangerous when wet. I´d fear for my life if there was a fire, as a fire truck would not be able to get past all the curbparked cars. There was also a major problem with spiders in the summer and spring. There is a "Pond" near the back of the complex that breeds some strange bugs! Finally, I found the walls to be incredibly thin, especially for the amount of money. I hear everything that goes on above me, and the pipes crack whenever they run water upstairs. Also note, that there are lots of families here and lots of kids running around! In short, I´d only live here again if I was on the top floor and near the front of the complex where there´s more parking!

Resident
2001 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/14/2002
I lived here for about a year now and was considering moving to a cheaper place but have changed my mind. These apartments are more expensive, but the extras are nice. Maintence is friendly and are straight foward, and I have had same day response on most request. Office staff are friendly. Apartments are reasonable. After talking to classmates I discovered that the parking issues are just about the same everywhere. I think they have had one or two car break-ins, but I have heard the same from my class mates as well. If you can afford a nicer place it is well worth the money. Most of my friend would rather study here then at their place. Good number of grad students.
